main event: On 9 October 1957, a round, white object was sighted descending and ascending east of Salisbury, North Carolina. The object changed course and disappeared from view in 15-20 seconds.
interesting points: The sighting lasted 15-20 seconds, and the object was observed changing course and disappearing from view.
The conclusion was that without further detailed data, the object could be anything, but probably natural.
The document mentions a reliable aircraft commander and clear, unlimited visibility during the sighting.
It is noted that the object was sighted during the flight of a Soviet Earth satellite.
The report was filed by W. F. Russell, 2/LT USAF Intercept Control Assist ACMRON Aiken.
witnesses: reliable aircraft commander and ground observers
